title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful story about racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel exploring surveillance, totalitarianism, and the loss of freedom.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic tale of ambition, love, and the American Dream in the Jazz Age.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an epic quest filled with dwarves, dragons, and adventure.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about following your dreams and listening to your heart.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping exploration of human history, evolution, and cultural development.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A practical guide to building good habits through small, consistent changes.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A shocking psychological thriller about a woman who stops speaking after a crime.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: A deeply personal memoir by the former First Lady of the United States.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
description: A counterintuitive guide to living a meaningful, values-based life.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
description: Financial lessons on wealth-building and investment from two father figures.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: A guide to living fully in the present moment and detaching from ego.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and enters a magical world of adventure.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A rebellious teenager narrates his experiences of alienation and identity.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A woman becomes entangled in a missing-person case filled with twists.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist uncovers hidden secrets about the Holy Grail and ancient societies.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic tale of love, class, and social expectations in 19th-century England.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A touching love story between two teens battling terminal illness.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic intergalactic adventure following Earth's sudden destruction.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Insights into how humans think, make decisions, and form biases.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: An accessible explanation of cosmology, black holes, and the universe.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A chilling story of a haunted hotel and a man's descent into madness.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir of a woman who escapes a strict, abusive household to pursue education.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian world where teens must fight for survival in a televised arena.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son journey through a bleak world after an unnamed catastrophe.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic quest to destroy a powerful ring that could doom Middle-earth.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A moving story of friendship, guilt, and redemption set in Afghanistan.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A totalitarian society forces women into reproductive servitude.

title: The Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
description: Timeless lessons on wealth, greed, and happiness.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A sci-fi masterpiece exploring politics, religion, and power on the desert planet Arrakis.
